items.headline: I’m a widow with $200,000 in a brokerage account. So why am I treated so poorly?
items.summary_en: “I had to hunt high and low to have them sell my Tesla stock because it was tanking.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I’m getting a $100K personal-injury settlement. Will my estranged wife get any of it?
items.summary_en: “After we were hit by two major hurricanes, my wife secretly kept the disaster-recovery assistance money.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I’m $28,000 in debt. My credit score is suffering. How do I get out of this mess?
items.summary_en: “I had no credit-card debt until about four years ago. My husband went back to school.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘The money went into his account’: Is my father trying to swindle me out of my grandparents’ $800K home?
items.summary_en: “I came across a letter from my father’s bank showing a wire transfer of $195,000 from the buyer.”

items.headline: Are you middle class? No, you’re not. Here’s why.
items.summary_en: The middle class is dead. Long live the middle class.

items.headline: ‘I can only rely on me’: How do I protect myself from my parents’ nursing-home bills?
items.summary_en: “I do not expect or need anything from my parents.”

items.headline: As a nurse, I’ve seen people use their power of attorney to take advantage of their parents. It would chill you to the bone.
items.summary_en: “Even if someone has millions of dollars in retirement, that won’t keep them from being trapped in the hospital.”

items.headline: ‘I learned a hard lesson’: My ex-husband gambled away our $900,000 life savings. Do I use my 401(k) to buy a home?
items.summary_en: “I have about $80,000 in my 401(k) and $10,000 in savings.”

items.headline: How social media convinces investors they’re the next Warren Buffett — or smarter
items.summary_en: Internet investing sites and tips give people a false — and costly — sense of their abilities, studies show. Legendary investor Howard Marks has a solution.
